### **CORPO SNAKE â€“ Lighting the Fuse**

âœ”ï¸ **Hotel security is on alert.** Extra guards at the doors, drones patrolling the balconies. **They think somethingâ€™s up.**

âœ”ï¸ **A Dynacorp response team just rolled up.** Black SUVs, armored, **four-man squad stepping outâ€”tactical gear, silenced weapons.**

<!-- SCENE BREAK: S01E02_001 (episode heading) -->
# S01E02: Silo
## Storyteller
### **CORPO SNAKE â€“ WELCOME TO THE BADLANDS**

You push the **Yamaha Ghost** past city limits, the skyline shrinking in your mirrors. **Night Cityâ€™s neon fades into endless black**, only the **occasional rusted-out gas station or abandoned factory** breaking the emptiness.  

The air here **tastes different**â€”**dry, electric, charged with ozone.** No corp security, no surveillance dronesâ€”just **dust, danger, and the ghosts of old wars.**  

Youâ€™re alone. **Almost.**  

Your HUD **flickers.** An old **radio transmission band** cuts through the static:  

**"â€¦Approaching restricted airspace. All unauthorized vehicles will beâ€”"**  

You kill the feed. **Wrong corps, wrong battlefield.** The past **lingers** out here, but youâ€™ve got bigger problems.  

---

### **THE RENDEZVOUS**

No-Name Peteâ€™s **coordinates** take you into an **abandoned missile silo**, buried deep in the desert. You follow an old **cracked service road**, headlights catching flashes of **old-world military wreckageâ€”burned-out tanks, shredded VTOL husks, minefields that may or may not be dead.**  

Finally, you hit **a chain-link gate**, reinforced with **rusted plating and solar panels.** The **sign on the fence is hand-painted, in red:**  

**â€œNOTHING WORTH DYING FOR PAST THIS POINT.â€**  

You cut the engine. The silence is **absolute.** Just the distant hum of **wind turbines** and the occasional **animal scream from somewhere too far to matter.**  

Thenâ€”**movement.**  

A turret **deploys from the sand**, old but **functional.** You hear **servo motors whine**, adjusting its aim **right at your head.**  

Then, a **voice from the intercom:**  

**"If you're selling something, I don't want it. If you're lost, you're already dead. And if you're Corpo, you can fuck off right now."**  

Thatâ€™s gotta be Pete.  

**Whatâ€™s your approach?**  

1. **Go full tech-nerd.** Youâ€™ve got his cyberdeck, talk like youâ€™re a fellow enthusiast.  
2. **Be direct.** You have something heâ€™ll want to see, and time is running out.  
3. **Throw him off.** Tell him Dynacorp is already onto himâ€”paranoia might make him listen.

## You
Doesnâ€™t he know me? â€œHey, itâ€™s just me! You didnâ€™t recognize me in my cool new nullcloak. I brought you a preeeeesent!â€ I slowly pull out the vintage deck.

<!-- SCENE BREAK: S01E03_024 (storyteller heading) -->
## Storyteller
### **CORPO SNAKE â€“ WHO THE HELL IS PETE, REALLY?**

Alinaâ€™s **revelation hangs in the air**, the bunker feeling **smaller, heavier** than before. You sit with it for a momentâ€”**letting it settle**â€”before finally turning to Pete.  

Heâ€™s been **quiet**, arms crossed, staring at the ground like heâ€™s **trying to work out whether or not he wants to throw up.**  

You watch him for a beat, then gesture around the bunker. **â€œAlright, man. Weâ€™ve been unraveling my problems all night. Your turn.â€**  

Pete **snorts**, running a hand over his shaved scalp. **â€œWhat, you wanna psychoanalyze *me* now?â€**  

You **shrug.** **â€œJust realizing I donâ€™t actually know shit about how you live out here.â€**  

---

### **PETE'S LIFE IN THE BADLANDS**

He stretches, cracking his back, then **waves a hand around the bunker.** **â€œWhatâ€™s there to know? I built a hole in the ground, stocked it with tech, and occasionally trade with people so I donâ€™t die.â€**  

**"Trade with who?"**  

He **leans back against the workbench.**  

âœ” **Scavengers & Fixers** â€“ People who **find old-world tech and need it repaired.** They bring him **pre-collapse processors, abandoned military gear, broken cyberdecks.** He fixes what he can, **keeps the good parts, sells the rest.**  
âœ” **Nomad Clans** â€“ Heâ€™s **not one of them,** but heâ€™s got **a few friendly contacts** in the drifting caravans. Sometimes they **bring him supplies in exchange for hacking jobs.**  
âœ” **Local Badlands Settlers** â€“ Small pockets of people living **off-grid**, raising **livestock, growing food in biodomes.** Pete **doesnâ€™t farm, but he knows people who do.**  

---

### **DOES PETE HAVE FAMILY?**

He **hesitates** at that one.  

Then:  

**"Yeah. Had a family. Past tense."**  

He exhales, rubbing his temples.  

**"I was corporate once, same as you. A long time ago. But I had this little problem where I actually *gave a shit* about the people under me. Turns out, thatâ€™s not a great survival trait in the corporate world.â€**  

He shakes his head.  

**"I stepped on the wrong toes, pissed off the wrong exec, and suddenly, *poof*â€”no pension, no severance, no future. My wife left before I even got my desk cleared out. I donâ€™t blame her. She knew the score before I did.â€**  

A beat.  

**"My kid... he was too young to understand. I thought about reaching out once I got set up out here. But by then, I figured he was better off thinking I was dead."**  

---

### **THE KIND OF MAN PETE IS**

âœ” **Once corporate, but not built for it.** He had **empathy**â€”a **liability** in that world.  
âœ” **Lost everything and never tried to get it back.** Some part of him **thinks he deserved it.**  
âœ” **Still connected, but only at a distance.** Trades, barters, but **doesnâ€™t let anyone get too close.**  

You watch him for a long moment, then **nod.**  

**"Sounds lonely as hell."**  

He **grins**, but thereâ€™s no humor in it.  

**"Yeah. But it beats getting stabbed in the back again."**  

---

### **NEXT MOVE?**

1. **Tell him heâ€™s full of shit.** He clearly still caresâ€”he wouldnâ€™t be helping you if he didnâ€™t.  
2. **Leave it alone.** Youâ€™re not here to fix Pete.  
3. **Ask if he ever wants to see his kid again.** What would it take for him to reach out?

## You
1
